location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 421: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commander of the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell requests that the Commander of the HC sloop Clivebe instructed to touch at Muscat on his voyage to Bombay, in order to deliver 300 German crowns to the Native Agent, Khojeh Hiskael [Khojah Hiskal]. Hennell further requests that the Commander obtain information from the Agent regarding the soor boat which, after being robbed by the pirate, Soheil ben Ateish, attacked and plundered a minaw vessel that was conveying goods for a dependent of the Chief of Aboothabee [Abu Dhabi]. Hennell specifically requests the names of the nakhoda [nakhuda] and crew and the exact whereabouts of the boat in question.
